metadata.trigger: when working on GitHub Actions workflows or CI caching

rule.name: Reference Implementations
rule.description: Use these repos as reference for CI patterns

reference.description: Super-fast iOS builds with proper caching

rule.name: iOS Pods and DerivedData Cache Consistency
rule.description: Pods project files contain hardcoded paths to DerivedData
rule.problem: Pods cache contains xcodeproj files that reference paths like ios/build/generated/ios/*.cpp. If Pods restores but DerivedData doesn't, build fails with "Build input file cannot be found".

solutions.solution: Use exact-match only for Pods cache (no restore-keys fallback)
Ensure DerivedData cache key is superset of Pods cache key
Restore DerivedData AFTER pod install runs (like Nitro does)

rule.antipattern: Using restore-keys for Pods cache can restore stale Pods that reference non-existent codegen files.

guidelines.guideline: Don't use version suffixes (v2, v3) - just delete caches with gh cache delete --all
Include all files that affect cache contents in hashFiles()
DerivedData key should include everything Pods key includes, plus more

rule.name: Android Maestro App Launch
rule.problem: If you launch the app via adb before Maestro runs, Maestro's launchApp command will restart it, potentially breaking Metro connection.
rule.solution: Let Maestro handle app launch. Only install the APK before Maestro runs.

rule.name: Build Speed Targets
rule.description: Expected build times with proper caching
rule.notes: ccache handles C++ compilation caching. DerivedData/Gradle caches handle build artifacts.
